H0.text: Architectural design also benefits from the advanced atmosphere‑control systems used in modern submarines, which enable crews to stay below the ocean surface for months at a time.

H1.text: Pollution control also benefits from advanced atmosphere‑control systems that allow modern submarines to keep crews below the surface of the ocean for months at a time.

H2.text: Fire prevention also benefits from modern submarines' advanced atmosphere‑control systems that enable submarine crews to stay below the surface of the ocean for months at a time.

H3.text: Space exploration also benefits from advanced atmosphere‑control systems that allow submarine crews to remain below the ocean surface for months.

A4.text: The life support system of a surface saturation accommodation facility provides breathing gas and other services to support life for the personnel under pressure.

A5.text: The concept can also be extended to submarines, crewed submersibles and atmospheric diving suits, where the breathing gas requires treatment to remain respirable, and the occupants are isolated from the outside ambient pressure and temperature.

A6.text: Plants will Be Critical for Human Life Support Systems in Space

A7.text: Personal Hygiene in Space (Canadian Space Agency)
